meanings.definition: Tending or intending to subvert or overthrow, especially in a secretive or underhanded way.
meanings.sent1: The subversionary plot was uncovered by the vigilant detective.
meanings.sent2: The group's subversionary activities were a threat to national security.
meanings.sent3: The subversionary squirrel tried to steal all the nuts from the other animals.
meanings.sent4: Her subversionary tactics were like a silent storm brewing in the shadows.
meanings.sent5: The subversionary nature of the virus slowly weakened the system's defenses.

meanings.sent1: The subversionary elements in the movie added an unexpected twist.
meanings.sent2: The subversionary nature of the protest caught the authorities off guard.
meanings.sent3: The subversionary cake recipe turned out to be a delicious disaster.
meanings.sent4: His subversionary art challenged the traditional norms of society.
meanings.sent5: The subversionary tone of the conversation hinted at hidden agendas.
